It is easily my favorite in current generation games.

I am not even a gamer anymore, but borderlands is AMAZING. It’s even better with friends.

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Thug-life:

Actually, it was in development for most of those 12 years. Only official cease in development was when 3D realms went under. It was resumed when Gearbox got the rights to it.

It was “in development” it wasn’t in development.

Read full topic
item.source: Duke Nukem Forever Arrives On PC, Xbox 360, PS3 in 2011

item.title: Duke Nukem Forever Arrives On PC, Xbox 360, PS3 in 2011
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Actually, it was in development for most of those 12 years. Only official cease in development was when 3D realms went under. It was resumed when Gearbox got the rights to it.

There was a long article from ex-3D realms developers who talked about the lead designer constantly swapping staff around, constantly asking for money from publishers, constantly rewriting their entire game engine because of advancements in other games. His problem was that he couldn’t ever accept being anything less than the best game ever made, and this isn’t exaggeration, they spoke as if it was a real problem for him.

Obviously, it just then got to the point where they had spent their final budget 2k gave them, and couldn’t go any further. Everyone knows it won’t live up to the hype, even Gearbox know who are currently developing it. They were given it by 2k to finish it off and be done with it.

It will be released. The problem (3D realms) has been dealt with.

Read full topic
item.source: Duke Nukem Forever Arrives On PC, Xbox 360, PS3 in 2011
